p: The environmental situation of another coronavirus outbreak also seems to support the above-mentioned theory. MERS-CoV was first detected in a patient living in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, in June of 2012 [ 20]. The annual rainfall in Jeddah is low at 61mm, and there was no rain at all in June of that year in Jeddah [ 21]. Therefore, relative to temperature, low humidity seems to be a more critical environmental factor influencing outbreak of human coronavirus disease.
